maml:description.maml:para: Converts cryptocurrency prices between different currencies.

The Convert-CMCPrice cmdlet converts an amount of one cryptocurrency or fiat currency to its equivalent value in other cryptocurrencies or fiat currencies. This is useful for calculating portfolio values and exchange rates.
The amount to convert. Default: 1
The cryptocurrency or fiat currency symbol to convert from. Example: "BTC", "ETH", "USD"
One or more currency symbols to convert to. Can include both cryptocurrencies and fiat currencies. Example: "USD", "EUR", "BTC", "ETH"
One or more CoinMarketCap currency IDs to convert to.
Optional historical timestamp to convert prices at a specific point in time. Accepts DateTime object or string in ISO 8601 format.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The amount to convert. Default: 1
One or more currency symbols to convert to. Can include both cryptocurrencies and fiat currencies. Example: "USD", "EUR", "BTC", "ETH"
The CoinMarketCap currency ID to convert from.
One or more CoinMarketCap currency IDs to convert to.
Optional historical timestamp to convert prices at a specific point in time. Accepts DateTime object or string in ISO 8601 format.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The amount to convert. Default: 1
The cryptocurrency or fiat currency symbol to convert from. Example: "BTC", "ETH", "USD"
The CoinMarketCap currency ID to convert from.
One or more currency symbols to convert to. Can include both cryptocurrencies and fiat currencies. Example: "USD", "EUR", "BTC", "ETH"
One or more CoinMarketCap currency IDs to convert to.
Optional historical timestamp to convert prices at a specific point in time. Accepts DateTime object or string in ISO 8601 format.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns a conversion result object with the original amount and converted values.

maml:alert.maml:para: - Supports both cryptocurrency and fiat currency conversions
- Exchange rates are based on current market prices
- Historical conversions require appropriate API plan

dev:remarks.maml:para: Converts 1 Bitcoin to USD.
Converts $100 USD to Bitcoin, Ethereum, and Euro values.
Converts 0.5 Ethereum to Bitcoin, USD, and GBP.
Converts 1000 USDT to BTC and ETH using pipeline input.
Converts 1 BTC to USD at the specified historical date.

maml:description.maml:para: Exports CoinMarketCap data to various file formats.
The Export-CMCData cmdlet exports cryptocurrency data retrieved from CoinMarketCap to various file formats including CSV, JSON, and Excel. This is useful for data analysis, reporting, and sharing.
The cryptocurrency data to export. This should be output from other CMC cmdlets like Get-CMCListings, Get-CMCQuotes, etc.
The file path where the data should be exported. The file extension determines the export format (.csv, .json, .xlsx).
Explicitly specify the export format. Valid values: CSV, JSON, Excel. If not specified, the format is determined by the file extension.
Include additional metadata in the export (timestamp, source, etc.).
Focus export on specific currency columns (e.g., USD, EUR, BTC). Reduces file size by excluding other currency data.
Specify which properties to include in the export. If not specified, all properties are included.
Return the exported data object for further processing.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
{{ Fill InputData Description }}
The file path where the data should be exported. The file extension determines the export format (.csv, .json, .xlsx).
Explicitly specify the export format. Valid values: CSV, JSON, Excel. If not specified, the format is determined by the file extension.
Include additional metadata in the export (timestamp, source, etc.).
Focus export on specific currency columns (e.g., USD, EUR, BTC). Reduces file size by excluding other currency data.
Specify which properties to include in the export. If not specified, all properties are included.
Return the exported data object for further processing.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The cryptocurrency data to export. This should be output from other CMC cmdlets like Get-CMCListings, Get-CMCQuotes, etc.
{{ Fill InputData Description }}
The file path where the data should be exported. The file extension determines the export format (.csv, .json, .xlsx).
Explicitly specify the export format. Valid values: CSV, JSON, Excel. If not specified, the format is determined by the file extension.
Include additional metadata in the export (timestamp, source, etc.).
Focus export on specific currency columns (e.g., USD, EUR, BTC). Reduces file size by excluding other currency data.
Specify which properties to include in the export. If not specified, all properties are included.
Return the exported data object for further processing.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Exports data to the specified file format.

maml:alert.maml:para: - CSV format is best for simple data analysis in Excel or other tools
- JSON format preserves complex data structures and is good for APIs
- Excel format (.xlsx) requires the ImportExcel module for best results
- Large datasets may take time to export, especially to Excel format

dev:remarks.maml:para: Exports the top 100 cryptocurrencies to a CSV file.
Exports specific cryptocurrency quotes to JSON with metadata.
Exports selected properties to Excel focusing on USD values.
Exports global market metrics and returns the data for further use.

maml:description.maml:para: Retrieves the stored CoinMarketCap API key.
The Get-CMCApiKey cmdlet retrieves the CoinMarketCap API key from either the current session or from persistent storage in the user's profile. Returns the key as a SecureString by default.
Specifies where to retrieve the API key from: - Session: Retrieves the key from the current PowerShell session
- User: Retrieves the key from persistent storage in the user's profile
- Auto: Automatically checks session first, then user profile (default)
If specified, returns the API key as plain text instead of a SecureString. WARNING: This exposes the API key in memory and should be used with caution.
If specified, tests the API key by making a request to the /key/info endpoint.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Specifies where to retrieve the API key from: - Session: Retrieves the key from the current PowerShell session
- User: Retrieves the key from persistent storage in the user's profile
- Auto: Automatically checks session first, then user profile (default)
If specified, returns the API key as plain text instead of a SecureString. WARNING: This exposes the API key in memory and should be used with caution.
If specified, tests the API key by making a request to the /key/info endpoint.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns the API key as either a SecureString (default) or plain text string.

maml:alert.maml:para: For security reasons, it's recommended to work with SecureString whenever possible. Use -AsPlainText only when absolutely necessary.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Retrieves the API key as a SecureString, checking session first then user profile.
Retrieves the API key as plain text.
Retrieves the API key from user profile and tests if it's valid.
Retrieves the API key and uses it to create a credential object.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of all cryptocurrency categories.

The Get-CMCCategories cmdlet retrieves a list of all cryptocurrency categories with their associated coins/tokens. Categories include DeFi, Stablecoins, NFTs, Exchange Tokens, and many more classification groups.
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 100
Filter categories by one or more category IDs.
Filter categories by one or more category slugs. Example: "defi", "stablecoin", "exchange-tokens"
Filter by one or more cryptocurrency symbols to see which categories they belong to.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 100
Filter categories by one or more category IDs.
Filter categories by one or more category slugs. Example: "defi", "stablecoin", "exchange-tokens"
Filter by one or more cryptocurrency symbols to see which categories they belong to.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns an array of category objects with details about each category.

maml:alert.maml:para: - Categories help organize and classify cryptocurrencies
- Each cryptocurrency can belong to multiple categories
- Use Get-CMCCategory for detailed info about a specific category

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all cryptocurrency categories.
Gets information about DeFi and Stablecoin categories.
Gets categories with more than 100 tokens.
Gets the categories that Bitcoin and Ethereum belong to.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the top cryptocurrency gainers and losers.

The Get-CMCGainersLosers cmdlet retrieves cryptocurrencies with the biggest gains or losses over a specified time period. This helps identify the best and worst performing cryptocurrencies in the market.
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 10, Max: 200
The time period to calculate gains/losses over. Valid values: 1h, 24h, 7d, 30d, 60d, 90d Default: 24h
Return gainers (desc) or losers (asc). Valid values: desc (gainers), asc (losers) Default: desc
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.
Optionally filter by minimum market cap (USD).
Optionally filter by maximum market cap (USD).
Optionally filter by minimum 24 hour volume (USD).
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 10, Max: 200
The time period to calculate gains/losses over. Valid values: 1h, 24h, 7d, 30d, 60d, 90d Default: 24h
Return gainers (desc) or losers (asc). Valid values: desc (gainers), asc (losers) Default: desc
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.
Optionally filter by minimum market cap (USD).
Optionally filter by maximum market cap (USD).
Optionally filter by minimum 24 hour volume (USD).
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns an array of cryptocurrency objects sorted by performance.

maml:alert.maml:para: - Gainers are cryptocurrencies with the highest positive price changes
- Losers are cryptocurrencies with the most negative price changes
- Results are filtered to exclude low volume/market cap coins by default

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the top 10 gainers in the last 24 hours.
Gets the top 10 losers in the last 24 hours.
Gets the top 20 gainers over 7 days with market cap over $1B.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CMCGainersLosers -SortDirection asc -TimePeriod "1h" | Format-Table name, symbol, USD_price, USD_percent_change_1h

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets hourly losers and displays formatted results.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 5 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # Get both gainers and losers $gainers = Get-CMCGainersLosers -Limit 5 $losers = Get-CMCGainersLosers -Limit 5 -SortDirection asc

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the top 5 gainers and top 5 losers.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets global cryptocurrency market metrics.

The Get-CMCGlobalMetrics cmdlet retrieves global cryptocurrency market metrics including total market cap, total volume, Bitcoin dominance, number of cryptocurrencies, and more. This provides an overview of the entire cryptocurrency market.
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns a global metrics object with market overview data.

maml:alert.maml:para: - Global metrics are updated every minute
- Market cap excludes coins/tokens not actively traded
- BTC dominance shows Bitcoin's percentage of total market cap

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets global market metrics in USD.
Gets global metrics with values in multiple currencies.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: $metrics = Get-CMCGlobalMetrics $metrics | Select-Object total_cryptocurrencies, active_market_pairs, USD_total_market_cap, btc_dominance

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets and displays specific global metrics.
Gets global metrics and displays all properties in list format.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets metadata for one or more cryptocurrencies.

The Get-CMCInfo cmdlet retrieves static metadata for one or more cryptocurrencies including name, symbol, logo, description, official website URL, social links, technical documentation, source code repository, and more.
One or more cryptocurrency symbols to get info for. Example: "BTC", "ETH", "ADA"
Optionally specify additional metadata fields to return. Valid values: urls, logo, description, tags, platform, date_added, notice, status Default returns all available fields.
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
One or more CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs to get info for. Example: 1, 1027, 2010
Optionally specify additional metadata fields to return. Valid values: urls, logo, description, tags, platform, date_added, notice, status Default returns all available fields.
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
One or more cryptocurrency slugs to get info for. Example: "bitcoin", "ethereum", "cardano"
Optionally specify additional metadata fields to return. Valid values: urls, logo, description, tags, platform, date_added, notice, status Default returns all available fields.
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
One or more contract addresses to get info for. Pass a contract address to return the cryptocurrency associated with it.
Optionally specify additional metadata fields to return. Valid values: urls, logo, description, tags, platform, date_added, notice, status Default returns all available fields.
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
One or more cryptocurrency symbols to get info for. Example: "BTC", "ETH", "ADA"
One or more CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs to get info for. Example: 1, 1027, 2010
One or more cryptocurrency slugs to get info for. Example: "bitcoin", "ethereum", "cardano"
One or more contract addresses to get info for. Pass a contract address to return the cryptocurrency associated with it.
Optionally specify additional metadata fields to return. Valid values: urls, logo, description, tags, platform, date_added, notice, status Default returns all available fields.
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: - You must specify exactly one of: Symbol, Id, Slug, or Address
- This endpoint returns static metadata that doesn't change frequently
- Use Get-CMCQuotes for price data

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets metadata for Bitcoin and Ethereum.
Gets specific metadata fields for Bitcoin.
Gets info for multiple cryptocurrencies using pipeline input.
Gets info for the cryptocurrency at the specified contract address (USDC).

maml:description.maml:para: Gets information about your CoinMarketCap API key.

The Get-CMCKeyInfo cmdlet retrieves information about your CoinMarketCap API key, including usage limits, remaining credits, and tier information. This is useful for monitoring your API usage and understanding your account limits.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns an object containing API key information, usage statistics, and limits.

maml:alert.maml:para: - This endpoint does not count against your API call limits
- Useful for monitoring usage and planning API calls
- Shows both current usage and historical statistics

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the current API key information including usage and limits.
Stores key info and displays remaining daily credits.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of all active cryptocurrencies with latest market data.
The Get-CMCListings cmdlet retrieves a paginated list of all active cryptocurrencies with latest market data from CoinMarketCap. By default, it returns the top 100 cryptocurrencies by market cap.
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally filter by maximum circulating supply.
Optionally filter by minimum 24 hour percent change.
Optionally filter by maximum 24 hour percent change.
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.

What field to sort the list by. Valid values: name, symbol, date_added, market_cap, market_cap_strict, price, circulating_supply, total_supply, max_supply, num_market_pairs, volume_24h, percent_change_1h, percent_change_24h, percent_change_7d, market_cap_by_total_supply_strict, volume_7d, volume_30d Default: market_cap
The direction in which to order cryptocurrencies. Valid values: asc, desc Default: desc
The type of cryptocurrency to include. Valid values: all, coins, tokens Default: all
Filter by one or more cryptocurrency tags. Valid values: all, defi, filesharing Note: For stablecoin filtering, use Get-CMCMap with filtering or Get-CMCCategory with 'stablecoin' category

Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: num_market_pairs, cmc_rank, date_added, tags, platform, max_supply, circulating_supply, total_supply, market_cap_by_total_supply, volume_24h_reported, volume_7d, volume_7d_reported, volume_30d, volume_30d_reported, is_active, is_fiat
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 100, Max: 5000
Optionally filter by minimum USD price.
Optionally filter by maximum USD price.
Optionally filter by minimum market cap (USD).
Optionally filter by maximum market cap (USD).
Optionally filter by minimum 24 hour volume (USD).
Optionally filter by maximum 24 hour volume (USD).
Optionally filter by minimum circulating supply.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 100, Max: 5000
Optionally filter by minimum USD price.
Optionally filter by maximum USD price.
Optionally filter by minimum market cap (USD).
Optionally filter by maximum market cap (USD).
Optionally filter by minimum 24 hour volume (USD).
Optionally filter by maximum 24 hour volume (USD).
Optionally filter by minimum circulating supply.
Optionally filter by maximum circulating supply.
Optionally filter by minimum 24 hour percent change.
Optionally filter by maximum 24 hour percent change.
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.

What field to sort the list by. Valid values: name, symbol, date_added, market_cap, market_cap_strict, price, circulating_supply, total_supply, max_supply, num_market_pairs, volume_24h, percent_change_1h, percent_change_24h, percent_change_7d, market_cap_by_total_supply_strict, volume_7d, volume_30d Default: market_cap
The direction in which to order cryptocurrencies. Valid values: asc, desc Default: desc
The type of cryptocurrency to include. Valid values: all, coins, tokens Default: all
Filter by one or more cryptocurrency tags. Valid values: all, defi, filesharing Note: For stablecoin filtering, use Get-CMCMap with filtering or Get-CMCCategory with 'stablecoin' category

Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: num_market_pairs, cmc_rank, date_added, tags, platform, max_supply, circulating_supply, total_supply, market_cap_by_total_supply, volume_24h_reported, volume_7d, volume_7d_reported, volume_30d, volume_30d_reported, is_active, is_fiat
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns an array of cryptocurrency objects with market data.

maml:alert.maml:para: This endpoint requires authentication with a valid API key. Rate limits apply based on your CoinMarketCap plan.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the top 100 cryptocurrencies by market cap.
Gets the top 10 cryptocurrencies with prices in EUR and GBP.
Gets the top 20 DeFi tokens sorted by 24h price change.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: # To get stablecoins, use Get-CMCCategory instead: Get-CMCCategory -Id "604f4972deb11b559dfa7220" -Limit 20

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets stablecoins using the stablecoin category ID.
Gets cryptocurrencies priced between $100-$1000 with at least $1M daily volume.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a mapping of all cryptocurrencies to their CoinMarketCap IDs.

The Get-CMCMap cmdlet returns a mapping of all cryptocurrencies listed on CoinMarketCap including their name, symbol, slug, CoinMarketCap ID, and platform information. This is useful for converting between different cryptocurrency identifiers.
Filter by listing status. Valid values: active, inactive, untracked Default: active
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 5000, Max: 5000
What field to sort the list by. Valid values: id, cmc_rank Default: id
Optionally filter by one or more cryptocurrency symbols. Example: "BTC", "ETH"
Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: platform, first_historical_data, last_historical_data, is_active, status
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Filter by listing status. Valid values: active, inactive, untracked Default: active
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 5000, Max: 5000
What field to sort the list by. Valid values: id, cmc_rank Default: id
Optionally filter by one or more cryptocurrency symbols. Example: "BTC", "ETH"
Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: platform, first_historical_data, last_historical_data, is_active, status
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns an array of cryptocurrency mapping objects.

maml:alert.maml:para: - This endpoint is useful for finding CoinMarketCap IDs to use with other endpoints
- The map includes both active and inactive cryptocurrencies
- Results are cached for performance when called multiple times

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the ID map for all active cryptocurrencies.
Gets the ID mapping for specific cryptocurrencies.
Gets the first 100 inactive cryptocurrencies.
Gets all cryptocurrencies with platform information (tokens).
Gets the CoinMarketCap ID for Bitcoin.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets market pair information for a cryptocurrency.
The Get-CMCMarketPairs cmdlet retrieves a list of all active market pairs that a cryptocurrency is traded on including the exchange, quote currency, price, and volume.
A cryptocurrency symbol to get market pairs for. Example: "BTC"
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 100, Max: 5000
Optionally specify the sort direction of markets returned. Valid values: asc, desc Default: desc (best markets first)
Optionally specify the sort field for market pairs. Valid values: volume_24h_strict, effective_liquidity, market_score, market_reputation Default: volume_24h_strict
Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: num_market_pairs, market_url, price_quote, effective_liquidity, market_score, market_reputation
Optionally include only market pairs with this symbol as the quote currency. Example: "USD", "USDT", "BTC"
Optionally include only market pairs with this CoinMarketCap ID as the quote currency.
Filter market pairs by exchange category. Valid values: all, spot, derivatives, otc, futures Default: all
Filter market pairs by fee type. Valid values: all, percentage, no-fees, transactional-mining, unknown Default: all
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
A CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID to get market pairs for. Example: 1
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 100, Max: 5000
Optionally specify the sort direction of markets returned. Valid values: asc, desc Default: desc (best markets first)
Optionally specify the sort field for market pairs. Valid values: volume_24h_strict, effective_liquidity, market_score, market_reputation Default: volume_24h_strict
Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: num_market_pairs, market_url, price_quote, effective_liquidity, market_score, market_reputation
Optionally include only market pairs with this symbol as the quote currency. Example: "USD", "USDT", "BTC"
Optionally include only market pairs with this CoinMarketCap ID as the quote currency.
Filter market pairs by exchange category. Valid values: all, spot, derivatives, otc, futures Default: all
Filter market pairs by fee type. Valid values: all, percentage, no-fees, transactional-mining, unknown Default: all
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
A cryptocurrency slug to get market pairs for. Example: "bitcoin"
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 100, Max: 5000
Optionally specify the sort direction of markets returned. Valid values: asc, desc Default: desc (best markets first)
Optionally specify the sort field for market pairs. Valid values: volume_24h_strict, effective_liquidity, market_score, market_reputation Default: volume_24h_strict
Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: num_market_pairs, market_url, price_quote, effective_liquidity, market_score, market_reputation
Optionally include only market pairs with this symbol as the quote currency. Example: "USD", "USDT", "BTC"
Optionally include only market pairs with this CoinMarketCap ID as the quote currency.
Filter market pairs by exchange category. Valid values: all, spot, derivatives, otc, futures Default: all
Filter market pairs by fee type. Valid values: all, percentage, no-fees, transactional-mining, unknown Default: all
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
A cryptocurrency symbol to get market pairs for. Example: "BTC"
A CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID to get market pairs for. Example: 1
A cryptocurrency slug to get market pairs for. Example: "bitcoin"
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 100, Max: 5000
Optionally specify the sort direction of markets returned. Valid values: asc, desc Default: desc (best markets first)
Optionally specify the sort field for market pairs. Valid values: volume_24h_strict, effective_liquidity, market_score, market_reputation Default: volume_24h_strict
Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: num_market_pairs, market_url, price_quote, effective_liquidity, market_score, market_reputation
Optionally include only market pairs with this symbol as the quote currency. Example: "USD", "USDT", "BTC"
Optionally include only market pairs with this CoinMarketCap ID as the quote currency.
Filter market pairs by exchange category. Valid values: all, spot, derivatives, otc, futures Default: all
Filter market pairs by fee type. Valid values: all, percentage, no-fees, transactional-mining, unknown Default: all
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns market pair data including exchange info and trading metrics.

maml:alert.maml:para: - You must specify exactly one of: Symbol, Id, or Slug
- Market pairs are sorted by 24h volume by default
- This endpoint shows where a cryptocurrency can be traded

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets all market pairs for Bitcoin.
Gets the top 10 ETH/USDT trading pairs.
Gets spot market pairs for Bitcoin sorted by market score.
Gets all BNB market pairs with over $1M daily volume.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the latest OHLCV (Open, High, Low, Close, Volume) data for cryptocurrencies.
The Get-CMCOHLCV cmdlet retrieves the latest OHLCV (Open, High, Low, Close, Volume) market values for one or more cryptocurrencies for the current UTC day.
One or more cryptocurrency symbols to get OHLCV data for. Example: "BTC", "ETH", "ADA"
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
One or more CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs to get OHLCV data for. Example: 1, 1027, 2010
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
One or more cryptocurrency symbols to get OHLCV data for. Example: "BTC", "ETH", "ADA"
One or more CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs to get OHLCV data for. Example: 1, 1027, 2010
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns OHLCV data objects with open, high, low, close, and volume values.

maml:alert.maml:para: - You must specify either Symbol or Id parameter
- OHLCV data represents the current UTC day
- Volume is reported in the quote currency (e.g., USD volume)
- For historical OHLCV data, use Get-CMCHistoricalOHLCV

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets today's OHLCV data for Bitcoin.
Gets OHLCV data for multiple cryptocurrencies in EUR.
Gets OHLCV data using pipeline input.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 4 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CMCOHLCV -Id 1,1027 | Format-Table symbol, USD_open, USD_high, USD_low, USD_close, USD_volume

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets and formats OHLCV data for display.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the latest market quote for one or more cryptocurrencies.

The Get-CMCQuotes cmdlet retrieves the latest market quote for one or more cryptocurrencies. You can identify cryptocurrencies by symbol, CoinMarketCap ID, or slug. Use this endpoint to get detailed price and volume information for specific cryptocurrencies.
One or more cryptocurrency symbols to get quotes for. Example: "BTC", "ETH", "ADA"
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.

Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: num_market_pairs, cmc_rank, date_added, tags, platform, max_supply, circulating_supply, total_supply, market_cap_by_total_supply, volume_24h_reported, volume_7d, volume_7d_reported, volume_30d, volume_30d_reported, is_active, is_fiat
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
One or more CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs to get quotes for. Example: 1, 1027, 2010
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.

Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: num_market_pairs, cmc_rank, date_added, tags, platform, max_supply, circulating_supply, total_supply, market_cap_by_total_supply, volume_24h_reported, volume_7d, volume_7d_reported, volume_30d, volume_30d_reported, is_active, is_fiat
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
One or more cryptocurrency slugs to get quotes for. Example: "bitcoin", "ethereum", "cardano"
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.

Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: num_market_pairs, cmc_rank, date_added, tags, platform, max_supply, circulating_supply, total_supply, market_cap_by_total_supply, volume_24h_reported, volume_7d, volume_7d_reported, volume_30d, volume_30d_reported, is_active, is_fiat
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
One or more cryptocurrency symbols to get quotes for. Example: "BTC", "ETH", "ADA"
One or more CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency IDs to get quotes for. Example: 1, 1027, 2010
One or more cryptocurrency slugs to get quotes for. Example: "bitcoin", "ethereum", "cardano"
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.

Optionally specify additional data fields to return. Valid values: num_market_pairs, cmc_rank, date_added, tags, platform, max_supply, circulating_supply, total_supply, market_cap_by_total_supply, volume_24h_reported, volume_7d, volume_7d_reported, volume_30d, volume_30d_reported, is_active, is_fiat
If true, invalid lookups will be skipped instead of causing an error. Default: true
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns cryptocurrency quote objects with detailed market data.

maml:alert.maml:para: - You must specify exactly one of: Symbol, Id, or Slug
- This endpoint is more efficient than Get-CMCListings for specific cryptocurrencies
- Rate limits apply based on your CoinMarketCap plan

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the latest quotes for Bitcoin and Ethereum.
Gets Bitcoin quote with prices in EUR, GBP, and JPY.
Gets quotes for multiple cryptocurrencies using pipeline input.
Gets quotes by CoinMarketCap ID with additional supply and rank data.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets a list of stablecoin cryptocurrencies with latest market data.

The Get-CMCStablecoins cmdlet retrieves stablecoins from CoinMarketCap by filtering cryptocurrencies that are categorized as stablecoins. This is a convenience function that combines Get-CMCMap and Get-CMCQuotes to provide stablecoin-specific data.
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 20, Max: 100
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
What field to sort the list by. Valid values: market_cap, price, volume_24h, percent_change_24h Default: market_cap
The direction in which to order stablecoins. Valid values: asc, desc Default: desc
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 20, Max: 100
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
What field to sort the list by. Valid values: market_cap, price, volume_24h, percent_change_24h Default: market_cap
The direction in which to order stablecoins. Valid values: asc, desc Default: desc
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns an array of stablecoin cryptocurrency objects with market data.

maml:alert.maml:para: This function uses a known list of major stablecoins. For a comprehensive list, consider using the CoinMarketCap categories endpoint when it becomes available.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the top 20 stablecoins by market cap.
Gets the top 10 stablecoins with prices in EUR and GBP.
Gets the top 5 stablecoins by 24h trading volume.

maml:description.maml:para: Gets trending cryptocurrencies on CoinMarketCap.

The Get-CMCTrending cmdlet retrieves a list of trending cryptocurrencies based on the highest price movements and social media activity. This includes the most searched and most viewed cryptocurrencies over various time periods.
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 10, Max: 200
The time period to get trending cryptocurrencies for. Valid values: 24h, 7d, 30d Default: 24h
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
Optionally offset the start (1-based) of the paginated list of items to return. Default: 1
Optionally specify the number of results to return. Default: 10, Max: 200
The time period to get trending cryptocurrencies for. Valid values: 24h, 7d, 30d Default: 24h
Optionally calculate market quotes in up to 120 currencies at once. Default: USD
Optionally calculate market quotes by CoinMarketCap cryptocurrency ID instead of symbol.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

dev:type.maml:name: Returns an array of trending cryptocurrency objects with market data.

maml:alert.maml:para: - REQUIRES PAID PLAN (Hobbyist or higher)
- Trending is determined by search volume and price movements
- Results are updated regularly throughout the day
- Use this to identify cryptocurrencies gaining attention
- Free tier alternative: Use Get-CMCListings with sort by percent_change

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets the top 10 trending cryptocurrencies in the last 24 hours.
Gets the top 20 trending cryptocurrencies over the last 7 days.

command:example.maml:title: -------------------------- EXAMPLE 3 --------------------------
command:example.dev:code: Get-CMCTrending -Convert "EUR","GBP" | Format-Table name, symbol, EUR_price, EUR_percent_change_24h

dev:remarks.maml:para: Gets trending cryptos with prices in EUR and GBP.
Gets detailed quotes for the top 5 trending cryptocurrencies.

maml:description.maml:para: Sets the CoinMarketCap API key for the current session or persistently.
The Set-CMCApiKey cmdlet stores the CoinMarketCap API key either in memory for the current session or persistently in the user's profile. The API key is stored securely as a SecureString.
The CoinMarketCap API key to store. This can be either a regular string or a SecureString.
Specifies where to store the API key: - Session: Stores the key in memory for the current PowerShell session only
- User: Stores the key persistently in the user's profile (encrypted)
If specified, configures the module to use the CoinMarketCap sandbox API endpoint instead of the production endpoint.
Overwrites an existing API key without prompting for confirmation.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}
The CoinMarketCap API key to store. This can be either a regular string or a SecureString.
Specifies where to store the API key: - Session: Stores the key in memory for the current PowerShell session only
- User: Stores the key persistently in the user's profile (encrypted)
If specified, configures the module to use the CoinMarketCap sandbox API endpoint instead of the production endpoint.
Overwrites an existing API key without prompting for confirmation.
Shows what would happen if the cmdlet runs. The cmdlet is not run.
Prompts you for confirmation before running the cmdlet.
{{ Fill ProgressAction Description }}

maml:alert.maml:para: The API key is required to make requests to the CoinMarketCap API. You can obtain an API key from: https://coinmarketcap.com/api/

dev:remarks.maml:para: Sets the API key for the current session.
Stores the API key persistently in the user's profile.
Prompts for the API key securely and stores it for the sandbox environment.
